pageContext.description: Broad central rib and a groove down each side of blade.,  4 Rivet holes.  Top (hilt) rather bent.  2 rivet holes are cracked.
pageContext.other: 2-part,hand-drawn illustration, including cross-section.  With dimensions., Multiple handwritings and different ink types (especially under publications)., Second 2 lines of SITE information have been written over white-out label.
pageContext.publications: fig.d Arch. Journ. XI 414. but said to be from Shropshire.,  Waight "Uriconium" p 298. says Uriconium (Wroxeter),  L. F. Chitty, Archaeologia Cambrensis, IXXXIII (1928) 209.,  S.P.D. Riordain.  Archaeologia.  Vol 86 1936 p 312.  No. 9.
pageContext.collection: 1905, British Museum 11 6, purchased 1905. Wm. Wms. (i.e. William Williams) 1
pageContext.site: England, SALOP, (Shropshire), Wroxeter (possibly), 1838,, scratched on blade =, "this is what ? I found in, :the ground Wm. Wins"
pageContext.remarks: LOWER LEFT CORNER:,  Labelled as from "Wrexham.", [in pencil}:, A OK, LOWER RIGHT CORNER [in pencil]:, C 1
